value.name: Edinburgh councillors vote to freeze council tax
value.description: Edinburgh councillors have voted to freeze council tax, increase spending on filling potholes and shelve school cuts as they agreed the authority's £1.3bn budget for the year ahead. Plans passed by the Labour administration, Liberal Democrats and Conservatives also included a 7% rent rise for council tenants.

value.description: The City of York Council’s budget for 2024/25 is approximately £150 million, but it has now saved around £14 million – £4 million of which in adult and children’s social care. value.name: Liberal Democrats seek to strengthen new anti-SLAPPs legislation
value.description: The Liberal Democrats are proposing to strengthen a government backed Private Members Bill.

value.name: Tories ‘going backwards’ on gender equality target for candidates
value.description: About 70% of parliamentary candidates selected so far are male with most having a background in local government

value.name: York's finance officer warned against using one-off funds ahead of budget
value.description: The City of York Council’s chief finance officer wrote to all councillors warning against using one-off reserves to fund public services ahead of the annual budget meeting.

value.name: Canterbury City Council increases council tax bills for 2024/25 as budget agreed
value.description: Councillors have passed a “budget of common sense” which includes a raft of controversial new parking charges and £700,000 worth of savings.

value.name: Tories edge win in Hazlemere by-election by 33 votes
value.description: The Tories have narrowly won the Hazlemere by-election by just 33 votes as the Lib Dems were accused of lying during the campaign.

value.name: NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh says Liberals and New Democrats have a deal on pharmacare
value.description: The federal Liberal government and the NDP have come to an agreement on pharmacare, clearing the way for the two parties to continue operating under the confidence-and-supply agreement that has helped keep the government in power over the past two years.

value.name: Conservatives need a bigger bazooka, Truss tells US right-wing event
value.description: Conservatives in both the US and UK need a "bigger bazooka" to fight the left, former PM Liz Truss has told an event in Washington DC. "Unless conservatives become more active in speaking out... Western civilisation is doomed," Ms Truss said. She was speaking at the biggest annual gathering of conservatives in the US.

value.name: York councillors vote through increase in council tax and cuts to services
value.description: Councillors have officially voted through an increase in council tax for residents in York. At the full council budget meeting on Thursday, February 22, a majority of councillors voted to increase the basic rate of council tax by 2.0 per cent and the adult social care precept by 2.99 per cent.

value.name: York council finance boss Debbie Mitchell's budget warning
value.description: City of York Council’s chief finance officer Debbie Mitchell wrote to all councillors warning against using one-off reserves to fund

value.name: Oxford City Council sets its budget for the coming year
value.description: Oxford City Council has set its budget for the coming year and it has chosen flowers for Frideswide Square over hardship funding.

value.name: Edinburgh councillors vote to freeze council tax
value.description: Edinburgh councillors have voted to freeze council tax, increase spending on filling potholes and shelve school cuts as they agreed the authority's £1.3bn budget for the year ahead. Plans passed by the Labour administration, Liberal Democrats and Conservatives also included a 7% rent rise for council tenants.

value.name: Lib Dem Roland Richardson wins Four Marks and Medstead by-election
value.description: Liberal Democrat Roland Richardson was elected as an East Hampshire district councillor in the Four Marks and Medstead by-election on February 15 with 62.2 per cent of the vote. Cllr Richardson received 1,212 votes, with the only other candidate ...

value.name: City of York Council sets budget including council tax hike
value.description: The City of York Council’s budget for 2024/25 is approximately £150 million, but it has now saved around £14 million – £4 million of which in adult and children’s social care. Labour has blamed inadequate government funding and the exhaustion of reserves by previous administrations for the cuts.

value.name: ‘Folly’ not to raise Wokingham council tax by maximum amount
value.description: Wokingham Borough Council voted to increase council tax by the maximum amount allowed – 4.99 per cent – in a budget that also includes some

value.name: Older suburban women could hold key to next election, poll finds
value.description: Analysis by More In Common suggested the key cohort could be the key to deciding whether its a hung parliament or a landslide.

value.name: ‘Stop blaming fire service for council tax rise’
value.description: Blaming the fire service for putting 1% onto the Council Tax in Powys needs to stop, a senior councillor has said.

value.name: Britain’s HNWIs would vote Labour and want the incoming government to prioritise growing the economy

value.name: 2024 General Election 'will be decided by older women in suburbs'
value.description: A think tank has said the general election will be decided by a group of older women who live in the suburbs and voted Conservative in 2019

value.name: Liz Truss says world ‘needs Republican in White House’
value.description: Liz Truss criticised ‘conservatives in name only’ during a speech to the right-wing Cpac conference near Washington DC

value.name: Cut-off Somerset communities 'delighted' as new bus planned
value.description: A new bus that has been “worth fighting for” will restore a vital service to cut off communities in North East Somerset. There was outcry in Paulton after the “lifeline” 82 bus was cut last year, leaving an estate in the village without its beloved bus.

value.name: Tax hike of 4.99 per cent approved for Hull as council budget passed
value.description: Councillors have approved a hike in council tax of 4.99 per cent for Hull households as part of the budget for the coming financial year.

value.name: Who is Reform UK candidate for Mayor of London Howard Cox?
value.description: Reform UK London mayoral candidate Howard Cox at the party's campaign launch in Westminster, central London. FairFuelUK founder Mr Cox is running as the Reform UK candidate in the 2024 mayoral race and insisted he can beat Sadiq Khan. (Image: PA)

value.name: Scotland's XL Bully restrictions come into force as desperate search to rehome dogs ends
value.description: It becomes illegal to sell, exchange, gift or abandon the breed in Scotland today, meaning any dogs which did not find homes face being put down or confined to kennels for life.

value.name: Reform candidate Simon Danczuk is turned away from Rochdale by-election hustings 'by George Galloway supporters'
value.description: Reform UK's candidate Simon Danczuk was told by a member of staff that they had space for him to attend the husting but he couldn't speak

value.name: Half of Devon’s children left toothless by Tory dental plan say Lib Dems

value.name: Harrogate Town Council: Lib Dems issue plea to ‘get on with it’
